dialogues.text: go of the rope. and he can’t of it in front his fingers. to the ground. A rodeo blares from the large TV in the corner of the roo Brady holds a yellow cowboy shirt. He’s giving James his rodeo gear since the young cowboy is just starting out.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: This is Lane Scott’s old riding shirt. He won about 15 thousand dollars in one summer wearing this shirt. It was mine for a while. I probably had my best summer in it. If it fits you, you can have it too. Too short in the arms for me. Brady hands James the shirt and sits down next to Cat.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Damn.  63.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Some cowboys believe yellow is superstitious. That ones lucky though, ha? Brady smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: That one must just be ‘stitious’. They smile and watch James as he tries on the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t make it look bad. James fastens the buttons and holds out his arms.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: You can try those chaps on too. If they fit, go ahead and take them. He watches James trying on his chaps and spurs. Like a superhero seeing someone else wearing his cape.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: They fit perfect. Thanks Brades. Appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I can’t wait to ride in these bad boys. James motions the action of being on a bucking horse. He’ trying to seem manly, but it doesn’t come off. Brady watches James for another moment. James notices his stare and quickly looks away.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: James, do you still wrestle?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Do you still wrestle?  64.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Sometimes. Haven’t practiced in a while though.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I’m down for a match or two.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Come on. Let’s wrestle then. James looks confused. Cat smirks, although he too seems unsure if Brady is seri

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Why not? We used to practice together.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yah... Well... that was tenth grade.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Been a long day. Shake it up a bit. Brady looks determined. James gives in.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Aright. Ok. Brady and James shake hands. The boys start to circle aro each other. Very soon James has a smile on his face too. They go at each other, wrestling as hard as they can. Cle both of them have some training in the past. It looks like an even match for a while. James even seems have an upper hand. Then, suddenly, Brady takes it seriously. He grabs onto J and puts him in a choke hold, flips him over his shoulder pins him onto the ground. James struggles to get out of Brady’s hold. His legs kick out. But Brady holds him tight, too tight. James struggle to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aright! I’m good. Brady. I’m pinned!  65. James is clearly in pain. But Brady doesn’t let him go, keeping him in the choke hold.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ok... Brady...

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Aright, aright. Cat pulls Brady away from James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fuck Brady! Now getting some air in his lungs, James gets up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: You aright? Brady immediately feels guilty.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Didn't hurt you, did I?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Told you I was pinned! Told you I was done! What’s the matter with you!?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Cowboy up partner. James shakes his head and walks away. Cat walks into the kitchen, leaving Brady alone. Brady wipes his face, steadies his breath. He looks up at TV - the screen shows the replay of a cowboy riding bucki horse in slow motion. EXT. CAT’S TRAILER - NIGHT A moth rest on the florescent light. The sound of a tatto gun buzzing. Cat is finishing up the tattoo of Lane on Brady’s back.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: You don’t think I was too hard on James, do you?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Nah. He is aright.  66. The room falls silent again. Cat looks at Brady for a moment, while wiping blood off o his fresh tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: CAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, I know about your hand. I know you ain’t supposed to be rodeoing or anything like that. Brady doesn’t react. Cat starts tattooing again.

dialogues.speaker: CAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Must be tough. I know it’s tough. But... You just gotta learn to let it go, and move on.... Cat stops his tattoo gun and looks up at Brady.

dialogues.speaker: CAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or it will eat at ya. Brady's jaw is tense. He stays quiet.

dialogues.speaker: CAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s gotta be tough... I mean... I understand.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: No. You don’t understand. Cat stops, looks at Brady, waiting for him to say somethi else. But Brady is silent. INT. LANE’S ROOM - DAY Brady shows Lane the tattoo. PBR bull riding national fin is broadcasting on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: It’s you Lane. Your favorite picture of yourself on a bull. Lane is smiling and he starts to sign with his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: S, a, 1, t, y, salty. Brady laughs.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s pretty salty huh. I really like it! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really like how he puts the feet on there. That was a pretty good call huh? Lane sighs with a thumb up, grinning. Brady is helping Lane to change out of his t-shirt into a cowboy shirt. Lane’s body is thin and frail from the lack of movement. his back there is a large tattoo that reads “Say I wont”. Brady helps him to put the shirt on one sleeve at a time, wiping drool off of his mouth. There is a large tattoo covering the whole side of Lane’s body - the late legenda bull rider Lane Frost riding a bucking bull. Next to the tattoo, a gastrostomy tube is inserted into Lane’s flesh. Brady bottoms up Lane’s shirt. Lane looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looking good stud muffin. Lane smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four PHYSIOTHERAPISTS help Lane to get on a practice sadd a saddle strapped on a wooden platform with reins attache the front. Lane’s shaking hand reaches for the horn of the saddle. B quickly takes his hand and places it onto the horn and ho onto Lane’s hand so it doesn’t slip off. It’s a difficult process, but Lane eventually sits onto t saddle. He looks up at Brady with a big grin on his face. Brady takes Lane’s cowboy hat and puts it onto Lane’s hea

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Don’t wanna get a sunburn. Lane starts to move his body back and forth as if he is o galloping horse, holding the reins in each hand, while Br holds the other two ends of the rein, standing in front o Lane. Lane has trouble keeping his head up.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look up at me brother. Look up at me, Lane.  68. Lane slowly rise his head. Shaking his body faster as if is riding fast. Brady starts laughing with Lane out of pure joy at seeing friends spirits so high.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Halt boy. Now slow him down a little bit. Back him up. Lane stops shaking and slowly pulling the reins back.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now sit up straight. Let’s do some loping. Go fast! Lane starts to shake his body again. They both start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Really loping off to the distance huh? You bet. Now stop. Say halt boy. Let me hear you say halt... Lane makes a low sound through his damaged vocal cords.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good job. Now you better watch out. She may start bucking. Keep a good tight seat on there. You better lift up your rein. Lane struggles to keep his head up.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lift, lift... lift... Lane’s head sinks lower.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got her pull up now... Suddenly, Brady stops smiling, a wave of sadness hits him looks down, takes a deep breath and looks up at Lane, who head is still down. Brady straightens his body, his face firm.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look up Lane. Look up at me brother. Pick your head up. Way up. Lane struggles painfully but lifts his head up slowly, wi proud smile on his face.  69.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go Lane. Good work. You got it now. Stay tough. Brady says goodbye to Lane. They do their usual complicat hand shake. Brady helps Lane with his hand. Then he lifts Lane’s arm up so they can give each other a hug. They hug for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you brother. It’s really good seeing you. Lane gives Brady the thumb up.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta get home though. I will be back soon. Keep working hard. Brady walks away leaving Lane behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady drives for a while in silence. Loud wind blowing outside the window. He tries to hold back but can’t. Tears roll down his face quickly pulls over and breaks down sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady puts his hat on the wall. Takes off his shirt and starts cleaning the room. He notices his rodeo bag in the corner, gathering dust. He pulls his chaps and riding rope out of the bag. Holdin the black and white rope tightly in his hand, stretching in front of him as if he is riding a bronc horse. Then slowly, he stops and puts the rope down. Brady sits at the edge of the bed and cleans his pistol. sits back in bed and draws the pistol as if he was in an western movie, aiming the gun at himself in the closet mirror. The broken mirror distorts Brady’s face, fracturi it as he rubs his throbbing brow. Lilly’s paper stars dot the wall behind him like bullet holes.  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady walks around. It’s windy. He whistles and calls out Apollo. He grows impatient. His whistle louder. But there is stil sign of Apollo in the wide open plains. Brady keeps walking. He stops when he notices something - A broken fence. The barbwire is broken and tangled. Brady quickly runs over. Blood and flesh scatter the grou Brady finds Apollo. The barbed wire has badly cut through his joint like a hacksaw. Apollo is breathing harshly. Brady looks at the deep, bone cutting wound. His heart si He tries to get Apollo to walk, but the injured horse tri and cries out loudly, neighing, panting. Brady knows what needs to be done. He sits down for a mom Looks at Apollo for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry buddy. Should’ve stayed close to home... Brady takes his pistol out of the gun holder. He stands u takes a deep breath, toughens up and points it at Apollo. Suddenly Apollo shakes his head, panicked, neighing, whin as if he understood what Brady is about to do. The last bit of toughness in Brady is gone. He can’t do i He uncocks the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has disappeared behind the Badlands. Wayne checks the bullets in the pistol and takes the rein from Brady.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Whistle for him when you walk away please. Brady walks away from them.  71. Wayne points the gun at Apollo, unmoved. He has done this many times. Brady stops. He is facing away from Wayne and Apollo. He waits for a moment. The wind picks up. He whistles. BANG! A loud gun shot immediately follows, echoing out ov the hills. Brady steadies his breath, staying tough. He spits and wa away. Behind him, Wayne takes his hat off as he looks dow Apollo's lifeless body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow motion of Brady’s hands, washing away Apollo’s blood Water dripping down his face. His eyes are blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady wakes up slowly. He gets dressed methodically for the rodeo. He puts his rodeo hat on - a grey felt hat with an eagle feather. He looks himself in the mirror. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly is reading. Brady sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I love you Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: I love you too. Brady watches Lilly for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Apollo got hurt and we had to put him down.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yah.  72.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Like skeleton?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yah. You know I got hurt too, right? Just like Apollo did.... But I got to live... He takes his cowboy hat off and looks at the dent still l from the horse hoof.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was only kept alive because... I’m human... If an animal around here... got hurt as bad as I did, we'll have to put them down. It just not fair to them if they can’t do what they were born to do...

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yah. They go to heaven. EXT. BRADY’S TRAILER - DAY Brady loads the saddle into his pickup. Wayne walks up.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Where are you going with that?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Where does it look like I’m going? I’m going to the rodeo. Wayne is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You fucking crazy?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna ride. I figured you’1l come and watch.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What the fuck do I wanna come for? Watch you kill yourself?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna fucking ride, aright, dad?  73.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Whatever. You never listen to anything anyone says. Brady almost laughs. He turns around to face Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I don’t listen?! I always fucking listened. Everything you ever fucking said to me! What happened to “cowboy up”, “grit your teeth”? Didn't you always say “be a man Brady! Fucking step up, get back on, be a man!?” What happened to all that, Dad? Wayne doesn’t look at Brady. His stern face now has a hin sadness.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Well, not today. He tries to take Brady’s bronc saddle from the truck. WAYNE (CONT’D) You don’t need to fucking go...

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Bull shit. I’m fucking riding! Brady grabs the saddle to keep it in place.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Fine! Wayne lets go of the saddle. WAYNE (CONT’D) Go kill yourself then! He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Look at you now. What’re you good for?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I made you! Brady watches Wayne walking back to the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna end up like you.  74. Wayne stops for a moment, but there’s nothing to say. Brady quickly gets into the truck and drives away. EXT. BRADY’S TRUCK ON HIGHWAY Brady’s truck is seen from a distance. A tiny vehicle barreling through the endless badlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady's eyes are fixed on the road. He looks down at the passenger seat and notices something - Lilly’s recorder. He picks it up and presses play. Lilly’s cheerful voice rattles out of it. As always Lilly’s words are unique onl to her, but Brady finds comfort in hearing her voice. He cant help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: I know it’s your train Elmo, but I only played a little minute. I’11l give it back, I promise. And you know what? This is amazing! Good! Always names like me... Lilly! The recorder goes dead. Brady's smile drops and his eyes focus on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady walks into the rodeo with his saddle and gear acros his back. He is reunited with the boys. Moving passed Tanner and Ja shaking hands as he goes. Everyone is happy to see him.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey Brady!

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Hey Brady! What you doing here? Brady forces a smile. He takes a spot by the fence and starts to puts on his ch and spurs. He looks over to see Cat giving him a look as he too gets ready to ride.  75. The rodeo is in full swing. A bareback rider leaps from t gate and is immediately bucked off his horse in a cloud o dust. The crowd gasps and cheers as he hits the ground ha Brady puts on his spurs and prepares his saddle. He keeps shaking his right hand. He sits on the saddle on the ground and puts chalk onto t grip. ANOTHER RIDER approaches him. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: RIDER
dialogues.text: Good to see you back, Brady!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yah, you too! Brady goes back to his saddle and immediately grabs his h rubbing his temple. He’s in pain and it shows. Brady goes behind the chute to get his horse ready. The w bucking horse begins to go berserk in the Chute. Leaping trying to get free. The riders try to hold it down as it kicks and struggles against the metal bars. You have to b either brave or stupid to get on an animal like that. Bra seems determined to be both. The horse falls to the ground and Brady lowers his body d dangerously into the chute to pull the horse back to its feet. The Horse stands and smashes once again against the bars before finally calming down. Brady stops for a moment, watching another ride. He looks around and something catches his eye. Wayne and Lilly are in the audience, standing by the fenc Lilly sees Brady and waves. Brady is surprised to see them. He holds back his emotion and forces a smile. Wayne nods at Brady, acknowledging his son. Letting him k that his family have come to support him. Brady nods back, but quickly walks away, jumping from the chute and tries to focus, doing his stretches, going thro his routine. The bright sun glares behind him. Brady is pacing back and forth. He is breathing hard. He looks down at his hand and realizes that, once again, it’ gripping on its own, so tight, his knuckles are pale. He tries to peel open his hand but it doesn’t work. He struggles to let go.  76. Brady thinks for a moment, then he steadies his breath an slowly closes his eyes. The sound of the crowd starts to fade around Brady. He is struggling anymore, he just stands there. Then - His hand, still trembles, but his fingers slowly open up their own and let go. The heavy rope drops onto the ground. Brady opens his eyes. Almost surprised as he looks down a his open palm. The boys are calling out to him now. It’s his turn to rid But Brady doesn’t move. Cat jumps off the chute to check on him.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: You aright? Brady looks at his relaxed hand and up at Cat.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yah.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Come on then. Brady doesn’t move. They look at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Good luck, partner. Brady reaches his hand out. Cat looks at him thoughtfully Then he reaches out to shake Brady’s hand in a moment of quiet understanding and respect.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: You too, Cowboy. Brady turns and walks away. Music plays - The beautiful moments of the rodeo at dusk. Young riders risking it all in the arena. Their friends cheering them in the chute. Kids sitting on top of the fences, their da hair blowing in the wind - the next generation of riders.  77. Brady walks towards Wayne and Lilly, who waits for him in distance. Wind picks up and blows the dust into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady and Lilly sit in the back of the truck. The Badland a shade of purple and blue around them. The road unravelling behind is endless, stretching all th way to the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music continues - Brady watches as Lane takes little steps with a walking machine at the rehabilitation center. Each step he makes an achievement, each made with great effort and pain, but Lane is smiling. His spirit is unbreakable. Brady cheers Lane on as Lane walks towards him. Music continues - INT. LANE’S ROOM - LATER Back in Lane’s room, the boys watch a winning bull ride L made years ago. He is at the stand, pumping his fist in t air. Everyone cheers for him. Brady and Lane both smile down at the video.

dialogues.speaker: LANE, (VIDEO)
dialogues.text: Motors runnin’, feelin’ great!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: There’s my brother. Lane has a big grin on his face. The video stops. Brady’s smile slowly fades. He struggles with his words.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry that I couldn’t be around. I was always rodeoing, going so much. I feel bad... He looks up at Lane.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I kind of understand how you must've felt... And... now that...  78.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t rodeo... for a while... I can at least come visit you more often. Brady looks down. It’s painful to finally admit it.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So... Lane stares at Brady. His hand shakes harshly, trying to convey his words to Brady. Brady spells out the words rea Lane’s hand gesture. BRADY (READING LANE’S SIGN LANGUAGE) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .--Don’t... give up on your dreams... He looks at Lane, who nods firmly at him. He continues to sign with his shaking left hand. Brady reads. BRADY (READING LANE’S SIGN LANGUAGE) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ---You’ve...got a.. better chance than I do... - You’ve got a Lane nods again. Satisfied to have communicated it to Bra Brady looks down, holding back his emotions. He gets up a stands in front of Lane.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. Look up at me brother. He takes Lane’s hands and Lane looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grab your reins. Now wheel them to the left. Lane pulls on Brady’s hand as if he were on a horse, and brady’s hands are the rein.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now to the right... Good job Lane. Go ahead, stop him. Back him up. Lane pulls Brady’s hands towards him.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You still got it. Lane has trouble keeping his head up. But he is smiling.  79.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're... You’re on big old Gus again. You remember old Gus. Loping across there. Lane is imagining riding Gus as Brady describes it. His f full of life and hope. Lane begins to remember -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plains and the Badlands - drifting through towards th light on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (V.O)
dialogues.text: Through the Badlands, chasing them cows out of the trees... A horse’s hooves gliding through the tall grass. INT. LANE’S ROOM - DAY

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: The sun’s shining. Wind blowing. Brady's face, watching Lane. He looks calm and content.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember the wind on your face. The sun in your eyes. Lane lifts his head up with a smile on his face. He close his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV from the rider - the head of the horse as it moves through the plains. The horse’s mane blowing in the wind. The rider is Brady. Brady is riding Gus again, in a luminous glow of sunlight The wind is blowing. Gus gallops across the plains. His powerful hooves flying through the grass. Brady’s face against the sky, content. Exactly where he wants to be.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: Music continues - Title. Credits roll.
